152  var _pluck = function ( a, prop, prop2 ) {
153  var out = [];
154  var i=0, ien=a.length;
155 
156  // Could have the test in the loop for slightly smaller code, but speed
157  // is essential here
158  if ( prop2 !== undefined ) {
159  for ( ; i<ien ; i++ ) {
160  if ( a[i] && a[i][ prop ] ) {
161  out.push( a[i][ prop ][ prop2 ] );
162  }
163  }
164  }
165  else {
166  for ( ; i<ien ; i++ ) {
167  if ( a[i] ) {
168  out.push( a[i][ prop ] );
169  }
170  }
171  }
172 
173  return out;
174  };
175 
176 
177  // Basically the same as _pluck, but rather than looping over `a` we use `order`
178  // as the indexes to pick from `a`
179  var _pluck_order = function ( a, order, prop, prop2 )
180  {
181  var out = [];
182  var i=0, ien=order.length;
183 
184  // Could have the test in the loop for slightly smaller code, but speed
185  // is essential here
186  if ( prop2 !== undefined ) {
187  for ( ; i<ien ; i++ ) {
188  out.push( a[ order[i] ][ prop ][ prop2 ] );
189  }
190  }
191  else {
192  for ( ; i<ien ; i++ ) {
193  out.push( a[ order[i] ][ prop ] );
194  }
195  }
196 
197  return out;

201  var _range = function ( len, start )
202  {

204  var end;
205 
206  if ( start === undefined ) {
207  start = 0;
208  end = len;
209  }
210  else {
211  end = start;
212  start = len;
213  }

215  for ( var i=start ; i<end ; i++ ) {
216  out.push( i );

219  return out;

235  var _unique = function ( src )
236  {
237  // A faster unique method is to use object keys to identify used values,
238  // but this doesn't work with arrays or objects, which we must also
239  // consider. See jsperf.com/compare-array-unique-versions/4 for more
240  // information.
241  var
242  out = [],
243  val,
244  i, ien=src.length,
245  j, k=0;
246 
247  again: for ( i=0 ; i<ien ; i++ ) {
248  val = src[i];
249 
250  for ( j=0 ; j<k ; j++ ) {
251  if ( out[j] === val ) {
252  continue again;
253  }
254  }
255 
256  out.push( val );
257  k++;
258  }
259 
260  return out;
261  };

272  function _fnHungarianMap ( o )
273  {
274  var
275  hungarian = 'a aa ao as b fn i m o s ',
276  match,
277  newKey,
278  map = {};
279 
280  $.each( o, function (key, val) {
281  match = key.match(/^([^A-Z]+?)([A-Z])/);
282 
283  if ( match && hungarian.indexOf(match[1]+' ') !== -1 )
284  {
285  newKey = key.replace( match[0], match[2].toLowerCase() );
286  map[ newKey ] = key;
287 
288  if ( match[1] === 'o' )
289  {
290  _fnHungarianMap( o[key] );
291  }
292  }
293  } );
294 
295  o._hungarianMap = map;
296  }

310  function _fnCamelToHungarian ( src, user, force )
311  {
312  if ( ! src._hungarianMap )
313  {
314  _fnHungarianMap( src );
315  }
316 
317  var hungarianKey;
318 
319  $.each( user, function (key, val) {
320  hungarianKey = src._hungarianMap[ key ];
321 
322  if ( hungarianKey !== undefined && (force || user[hungarianKey] === undefined) )
323  {
324  user[hungarianKey] = user[ key ];
325 
326  if ( hungarianKey.charAt(0) === 'o' )
327  {
328  _fnCamelToHungarian( src[hungarianKey], user[key] );
329  }
330  }
331  } );
332  }

419  function _fnBrowserDetect( settings )
420  {
421  var browser = settings.oBrowser;
422 
423  // Scrolling feature / quirks detection
424  var n = $('<div/>')
425  .css( {
426  position: 'absolute',
427  top: 0,
428  left: 0,
429  height: 1,
430  width: 1,
431  overflow: 'hidden'
432  } )
433  .append(
434  $('<div/>')
435  .css( {
436  position: 'absolute',
437  top: 1,
438  left: 1,
439  width: 100,
440  overflow: 'scroll'
441  } )
442  .append(
443  $('<div class="test"/>')
444  .css( {
445  width: '100%',
446  height: 10
447  } )
448  )
449  )
450  .appendTo( 'body' );
451 
452  var test = n.find('.test');
453 
454  // IE6/7 will oversize a width 100% element inside a scrolling element, to
455  // include the width of the scrollbar, while other browsers ensure the inner
456  // element is contained without forcing scrolling
457  browser.bScrollOversize = test[0].offsetWidth === 100;
458 
459  // In rtl text layout, some browsers (most, but not all) will place the
460  // scrollbar on the left, rather than the right.
461  browser.bScrollbarLeft = test.offset().left !== 1;
462 
463  n.remove();
464  }

472  function _fnAddColumn( oSettings, nTh )
473  {
474  var oDefaults = DataTable.defaults.column;
475  var iCol = oSettings.aoColumns.length;
476  var oCol = $.extend( {}, DataTable.models.oColumn, oDefaults, {
477  "sSortingClass": oSettings.oClasses.sSortable,
478  "sSortingClassJUI": oSettings.oClasses.sSortJUI,
479  "nTh": nTh ? nTh : document.createElement('th'),
480  "sTitle": oDefaults.sTitle ? oDefaults.sTitle : nTh ? nTh.innerHTML : '',
481  "aDataSort": oDefaults.aDataSort ? oDefaults.aDataSort : [iCol],
482  "mData": oDefaults.mData ? oDefaults.mData : iCol
483  } );
484  oSettings.aoColumns.push( oCol );
485 
486  /* Add a column specific filter */
487  if ( oSettings.aoPreSearchCols[ iCol ] === undefined || oSettings.aoPreSearchCols[ iCol ] === null )
488  {
489  oSettings.aoPreSearchCols[ iCol ] = $.extend( true, {}, DataTable.models.oSearch );
490  }
491  else
492  {
493  var oPre = oSettings.aoPreSearchCols[ iCol ];
494 
495  /* Don't require that the user must specify bRegex, bSmart or bCaseInsensitive */
496  if ( oPre.bRegex === undefined )
497  {
498  oPre.bRegex = true;
499  }
500 
501  if ( oPre.bSmart === undefined )
502  {
503  oPre.bSmart = true;
504  }
505 
506  if ( oPre.bCaseInsensitive === undefined )
507  {
508  oPre.bCaseInsensitive = true;
509  }
510  }
511 
512  /* Use the column options function to initialise classes etc */
513  _fnColumnOptions( oSettings, iCol, null );
514  }

524  function _fnColumnOptions( oSettings, iCol, oOptions )
525  {
526  var oCol = oSettings.aoColumns[ iCol ];
527  var oClasses = oSettings.oClasses;
528 
529  /* User specified column options */
530  if ( oOptions !== undefined && oOptions !== null )
531  {
532  // Backwards compatibility
533  _fnCompatCols( oOptions );
534 
535  // Map camel case parameters to their Hungarian counterparts
536  _fnCamelToHungarian( DataTable.defaults.column, oOptions );
537 
538  /* Backwards compatibility for mDataProp */
539  if ( oOptions.mDataProp !== undefined && !oOptions.mData )
540  {
541  oOptions.mData = oOptions.mDataProp;
542  }
543 
544  oCol._sManualType = oOptions.sType;
545 
546  // `class` is a reserved word in Javascript, so we need to provide
547  // the ability to use a valid name for the camel case input
548  if ( oOptions.className && ! oOptions.sClass )
549  {
550  oOptions.sClass = oOptions.className;
551  }
552 
553  $.extend( oCol, oOptions );
554  _fnMap( oCol, oOptions, "sWidth", "sWidthOrig" );
555 
556  /* iDataSort to be applied (backwards compatibility), but aDataSort will take
557  * priority if defined
558  */
559  if ( typeof oOptions.iDataSort === 'number' )
560  {
561  oCol.aDataSort = [ oOptions.iDataSort ];
562  }
563  _fnMap( oCol, oOptions, "aDataSort" );
564  }
565 
566  /* Cache the data get and set functions for speed */
567  var mDataSrc = oCol.mData;
568  var mData = _fnGetObjectDataFn( mDataSrc );
569  var mRender = oCol.mRender ? _fnGetObjectDataFn( oCol.mRender ) : null;
570 
571  var attrTest = function( src ) {
572  return typeof src === 'string' && src.indexOf('@') !== -1;
573  };
574  oCol._bAttrSrc = $.isPlainObject( mDataSrc ) && (
575  attrTest(mDataSrc.sort) || attrTest(mDataSrc.type) || attrTest(mDataSrc.filter)
576  );
577 
578  oCol.fnGetData = function (oData, sSpecific) {
579  var innerData = mData( oData, sSpecific );
580 
581  if ( oCol.mRender && (sSpecific && sSpecific !== '') )
582  {
583  return mRender( innerData, sSpecific, oData );
584  }
585  return innerData;
586  };
587  oCol.fnSetData = _fnSetObjectDataFn( mDataSrc );
588 
589  /* Feature sorting overrides column specific when off */
590  if ( !oSettings.oFeatures.bSort )
591  {
592  oCol.bSortable = false;
593  }
594 
595  /* Check that the class assignment is correct for sorting */
596  var bAsc = $.inArray('asc', oCol.asSorting) !== -1;
597  var bDesc = $.inArray('desc', oCol.asSorting) !== -1;
598  if ( !oCol.bSortable || (!bAsc && !bDesc) )
599  {
600  oCol.sSortingClass = oClasses.sSortableNone;
601  oCol.sSortingClassJUI = "";
602  }
603  else if ( bAsc && !bDesc )
604  {
605  oCol.sSortingClass = oClasses.sSortableAsc;
606  oCol.sSortingClassJUI = oClasses.sSortJUIAscAllowed;
607  }
608  else if ( !bAsc && bDesc )
609  {
610  oCol.sSortingClass = oClasses.sSortableDesc;
611  oCol.sSortingClassJUI = oClasses.sSortJUIDescAllowed;
612  }
613  }

715  function _fnColumnTypes ( settings )
716  {
717  var columns = settings.aoColumns;
718  var data = settings.aoData;
719  var types = DataTable.ext.type.detect;
720  var i, ien, j, jen, k, ken;
721  var col, cell, detectedType, cache;
722 
723  // For each column, spin over the
724  for ( i=0, ien=columns.length ; i<ien ; i++ ) {
725  col = columns[i];
726  cache = [];
727 
728  if ( ! col.sType && col._sManualType ) {
729  col.sType = col._sManualType;
730  }
731  else if ( ! col.sType ) {
732  for ( j=0, jen=types.length ; j<jen ; j++ ) {
733  for ( k=0, ken=data.length ; k<ken ; k++ ) {
734  // Use a cache array so we only need to get the type data
735  // from the formatter once (when using multiple detectors)
736  if ( cache[k] === undefined ) {
737  cache[k] = _fnGetCellData( settings, k, i, 'type' );
738  }
739 
740  detectedType = types[j]( cache[k] );
741 
742  // Doesn't match, so break early, since this type can't
743  // apply to this column. Also, HTML is a special case since
744  // it is so similar to `string`. Just a single match is
745  // needed for a column to be html type
746  if ( ! detectedType || detectedType === 'html' ) {
747  break;
748  }
749  }
750 
751  // Type is valid for all data points in the column - use this
752  // type
753  if ( detectedType ) {
754  col.sType = detectedType;
755  break;
756  }
757  }
758 
759  // Fall back - if no type was detected, always use string
760  if ( ! col.sType ) {
761  col.sType = 'string';
762  }
763  }
764  }
765  }

779  function _fnApplyColumnDefs( oSettings, aoColDefs, aoCols, fn )
780  {
781  var i, iLen, j, jLen, k, kLen, def;
782 
783  // Column definitions with aTargets
784  if ( aoColDefs )
785  {
786  /* Loop over the definitions array - loop in reverse so first instance has priority */
787  for ( i=aoColDefs.length-1 ; i>=0 ; i-- )
788  {
789  def = aoColDefs[i];
790 
791  /* Each definition can target multiple columns, as it is an array */
792  var aTargets = def.targets !== undefined ?
793  def.targets :
794  def.aTargets;
795 
796  if ( ! $.isArray( aTargets ) )
797  {
798  aTargets = [ aTargets ];
799  }
800 
801  for ( j=0, jLen=aTargets.length ; j<jLen ; j++ )
802  {
803  if ( typeof aTargets[j] === 'number' && aTargets[j] >= 0 )
804  {
805  /* Add columns that we don't yet know about */
806  while( oSettings.aoColumns.length <= aTargets[j] )
807  {
808  _fnAddColumn( oSettings );
809  }
810 
811  /* Integer, basic index */
812  fn( aTargets[j], def );
813  }
814  else if ( typeof aTargets[j] === 'number' && aTargets[j] < 0 )
815  {
816  /* Negative integer, right to left column counting */
817  fn( oSettings.aoColumns.length+aTargets[j], def );
818  }
819  else if ( typeof aTargets[j] === 'string' )
820  {
821  /* Class name matching on TH element */
822  for ( k=0, kLen=oSettings.aoColumns.length ; k<kLen ; k++ )
823  {
824  if ( aTargets[j] == "_all" ||
825  $(oSettings.aoColumns[k].nTh).hasClass( aTargets[j] ) )
826  {
827  fn( k, def );
828  }
829  }
830  }
831  }
832  }
833  }
834 
835  // Statically defined columns array
836  if ( aoCols )
837  {
838  for ( i=0, iLen=aoCols.length ; i<iLen ; i++ )
839  {
840  fn( i, aoCols[i] );
841  }
842  }
843  }

858  function _fnAddData ( oSettings, aDataIn, nTr, anTds )
859  {
860  /* Create the object for storing information about this new row */
861  var iRow = oSettings.aoData.length;
862  var oData = $.extend( true, {}, DataTable.models.oRow, {
863  src: nTr ? 'dom' : 'data'
864  } );
865 
866  oData._aData = aDataIn;
867  oSettings.aoData.push( oData );
868 
869  /* Create the cells */
870  var nTd, sThisType;
871  var columns = oSettings.aoColumns;
872  for ( var i=0, iLen=columns.length ; i<iLen ; i++ )
873  {
874  // When working with a row, the data source object must be populated. In
875  // all other cases, the data source object is already populated, so we
876  // don't overwrite it, which might break bindings etc
877  if ( nTr ) {
878  _fnSetCellData( oSettings, iRow, i, _fnGetCellData( oSettings, iRow, i ) );
879  }
880  columns[i].sType = null;
881  }
882 
883  /* Add to the display array */
884  oSettings.aiDisplayMaster.push( iRow );
885 
886  /* Create the DOM information */
887  if ( !oSettings.oFeatures.bDeferRender )
888  {
889  _fnCreateTr( oSettings, iRow, nTr, anTds );
890  }
891 
892  return iRow;
893  }

906  function _fnAddTr( settings, trs )
907  {
908  var row;
909 
910  // Allow an individual node to be passed in
911  if ( ! (trs instanceof $) ) {
912  trs = $(trs);
913  }

916  row = _fnGetRowElements( settings, el );
917  return _fnAddData( settings, row.data, el, row.cells );
918  } );
919  }

978  function _fnGetCellData( oSettings, iRow, iCol, sSpecific )

985  {
986  if ( oSettings.iDrawError != oSettings.iDraw && oCol.sDefaultContent === null )
987  {
988  _fnLog( oSettings, 0, "Requested unknown parameter "+
989  (typeof oCol.mData=='function' ? '{function}' : "'"+oCol.mData+"'")+
990  " for row "+iRow, 4 );
991  oSettings.iDrawError = oSettings.iDraw;
992  }

994  }

998  {

1004  return sData();
1005  }
1006 
1007  if ( sData === null && sSpecific == 'display' )
1008  {
1009  return '';
1010  }
1011  return sData;

1032  // Private variable that is used to match action syntax in the data property object
1033  var __reArray = /\[.*?\]$/;
1034  var __reFn = /\(\)$/;
1035 
1041  function _fnSplitObjNotation( str )
1042  {
1043  return $.map( str.match(/(\\.|[^\.])+/g), function ( s ) {
1044  return s.replace('\\.', '.');
1045  } );
1046  }

1048 
1056  function _fnGetObjectDataFn( mSource )
1057  {
1058  if ( $.isPlainObject( mSource ) )
1059  {
1060  /* Build an object of get functions, and wrap them in a single call */
1061  var o = {};
1062  $.each( mSource, function (key, val) {
1063  if ( val ) {
1064  o[key] = _fnGetObjectDataFn( val );
1065  }
1066  } );
1067 
1068  return function (data, type, extra) {
1069  return o[ o[type] !== undefined ? type : '_' ](data, type, extra);
1070  };
1071  }
1072  else if ( mSource === null )
1073  {
1074  /* Give an empty string for rendering / sorting etc */
1075  return function (data, type) {
1076  return data;
1077  };
1078  }
1079  else if ( typeof mSource === 'function' )
1080  {
1081  return function (data, type, extra) {
1082  return mSource( data, type, extra );
1083  };
1084  }
1085  else if ( typeof mSource === 'string' && (mSource.indexOf('.') !== -1 ||
1086  mSource.indexOf('[') !== -1 || mSource.indexOf('(') !== -1) )
1087  {
1088  /* If there is a . in the source string then the data source is in a
1089  * nested object so we loop over the data for each level to get the next
1090  * level down. On each loop we test for undefined, and if found immediately
1091  * return. This allows entire objects to be missing and sDefaultContent to
1092  * be used if defined, rather than throwing an error
1093  */
1094  var fetchData = function (data, type, src) {
1095  var arrayNotation, funcNotation, out, innerSrc;
1096 
1097  if ( src !== "" )
1098  {
1099  var a = _fnSplitObjNotation( src );
1100 
1101  for ( var i=0, iLen=a.length ; i<iLen ; i++ )
1102  {
1103  // Check if we are dealing with special notation
1104  arrayNotation = a[i].match(__reArray);
1105  funcNotation = a[i].match(__reFn);
1106 
1107  if ( arrayNotation )
1108  {
1109  // Array notation
1110  a[i] = a[i].replace(__reArray, '');
1111 
1112  // Condition allows simply [] to be passed in
1113  if ( a[i] !== "" ) {
1114  data = data[ a[i] ];
1115  }
1116  out = [];
1117 
1118  // Get the remainder of the nested object to get
1119  a.splice( 0, i+1 );
1120  innerSrc = a.join('.');
1121 
1122  // Traverse each entry in the array getting the properties requested
1123  for ( var j=0, jLen=data.length ; j<jLen ; j++ ) {
1124  out.push( fetchData( data[j], type, innerSrc ) );
1125  }
1126 
1127  // If a string is given in between the array notation indicators, that
1128  // is used to join the strings together, otherwise an array is returned
1129  var join = arrayNotation[0].substring(1, arrayNotation[0].length-1);
1130  data = (join==="") ? out : out.join(join);
1131 
1132  // The inner call to fetchData has already traversed through the remainder
1133  // of the source requested, so we exit from the loop
1134  break;
1135  }
1136  else if ( funcNotation )
1137  {
1138  // Function call
1139  a[i] = a[i].replace(__reFn, '');
1140  data = data[ a[i] ]();
1141  continue;
1142  }
1143 
1144  if ( data === null || data[ a[i] ] === undefined )
1145  {
1146  return undefined;
1147  }
1148  data = data[ a[i] ];
1149  }
1150  }
1151 
1152  return data;
1153  };
1154 
1155  return function (data, type) {
1156  return fetchData( data, type, mSource );
1157  };
1158  }
1159  else
1160  {
1161  /* Array or flat object mapping */
1162  return function (data, type) {
1163  return data[mSource];
1164  };
1165  }
1166  }
1167 
1168 
1176  function _fnSetObjectDataFn( mSource )
1177  {
1178  if ( $.isPlainObject( mSource ) )
1179  {
1180  /* Unlike get, only the underscore (global) option is used for for
1181  * setting data since we don't know the type here. This is why an object
1182  * option is not documented for `mData` (which is read/write), but it is
1183  * for `mRender` which is read only.
1184  */
1185  return _fnSetObjectDataFn( mSource._ );
1186  }
1187  else if ( mSource === null )
1188  {
1189  /* Nothing to do when the data source is null */
1190  return function (data, val) {};
1191  }
1192  else if ( typeof mSource === 'function' )
1193  {
1194  return function (data, val) {
1195  mSource( data, 'set', val );
1196  };
1197  }
1198  else if ( typeof mSource === 'string' && (mSource.indexOf('.') !== -1 ||
1199  mSource.indexOf('[') !== -1 || mSource.indexOf('(') !== -1) )
1200  {
1201  /* Like the get, we need to get data from a nested object */
1202  var setData = function (data, val, src) {
1203  var a = _fnSplitObjNotation( src ), b;
1204  var aLast = a[a.length-1];
1205  var arrayNotation, funcNotation, o, innerSrc;
1206 
1207  for ( var i=0, iLen=a.length-1 ; i<iLen ; i++ )
1208  {
1209  // Check if we are dealing with an array notation request
1210  arrayNotation = a[i].match(__reArray);
1211  funcNotation = a[i].match(__reFn);
1212 
1213  if ( arrayNotation )
1214  {
1215  a[i] = a[i].replace(__reArray, '');
1216  data[ a[i] ] = [];
1217 
1218  // Get the remainder of the nested object to set so we can recurse
1219  b = a.slice();
1220  b.splice( 0, i+1 );
1221  innerSrc = b.join('.');
1222 
1223  // Traverse each entry in the array setting the properties requested
1224  for ( var j=0, jLen=val.length ; j<jLen ; j++ )
1225  {
1226  o = {};
1227  setData( o, val[j], innerSrc );
1228  data[ a[i] ].push( o );
1229  }
1230 
1231  // The inner call to setData has already traversed through the remainder
1232  // of the source and has set the data, thus we can exit here
1233  return;
1234  }
1235  else if ( funcNotation )
1236  {
1237  // Function call
1238  a[i] = a[i].replace(__reFn, '');
1239  data = data[ a[i] ]( val );
1240  }
1241 
1242  // If the nested object doesn't currently exist - since we are
1243  // trying to set the value - create it
1244  if ( data[ a[i] ] === null || data[ a[i] ] === undefined )
1245  {
1246  data[ a[i] ] = {};
1247  }
1248  data = data[ a[i] ];
1249  }
1250 
1251  // Last item in the input - i.e, the actual set
1252  if ( aLast.match(__reFn ) )
1253  {
1254  // Function call
1255  data = data[ aLast.replace(__reFn, '') ]( val );
1256  }
1257  else
1258  {
1259  // If array notation is used, we just want to strip it and use the property name
1260  // and assign the value. If it isn't used, then we get the result we want anyway
1261  data[ aLast.replace(__reArray, '') ] = val;
1262  }
1263  };
1264 
1265  return function (data, val) {
1266  return setData( data, val, mSource );
1267  };
1268  }
1269  else
1270  {
1271  /* Array or flat object mapping */
1272  return function (data, val) {
1273  data[mSource] = val;
1274  };
1275  }
1276  }

1311  function _fnDeleteIndex( a, iTarget, splice )
1312  {
1313  var iTargetIndex = -1;
1314

1316  {
1317  if ( a[i] == iTarget )
1318  {
1319  iTargetIndex = i;
1320  }
1321  else if ( a[i] > iTarget )
1322  {
1323  a[i]--;
1324  }
1325  }
1326

1328  {
1329  a.splice( iTargetIndex, 1 );
1330  }

1397  function _fnGetRowElements( settings, row )
1398  {
1399  var
1400  d = [],
1401  tds = [],
1402  td = row.firstChild,
1403  name, col, o, i=0, contents,
1404  columns = settings.aoColumns;
1405 
1406  var attr = function ( str, data, td ) {
1407  if ( typeof str === 'string' ) {
1408  var idx = str.indexOf('@');
1409 
1410  if ( idx !== -1 ) {
1411  var src = str.substring( idx+1 );
1412  o[ '@'+src ] = td.getAttribute( src );
1413  }
1414  }
1415  };
1416 
1417  while ( td ) {
1418  name = td.nodeName.toUpperCase();
1419 
1420  if ( name == "TD" || name == "TH" ) {
1421  col = columns[i];
1422  contents = $.trim(td.innerHTML);
1423 
1424  if ( col && col._bAttrSrc ) {
1425  o = {
1426  display: contents
1427  };
1428 
1429  attr( col.mData.sort, o, td );
1430  attr( col.mData.type, o, td );
1431  attr( col.mData.filter, o, td );
1432 
1433  d.push( o );
1434  }
1435  else {
1436  d.push( contents );
1437  }
1438 
1439  tds.push( td );
1440  i++;
1441  }
1442 
1443  td = td.nextSibling;
1444  }
1445 
1446  return {
1447  data: d,
1448  cells: tds
1449  };
1450  }
1461  function _fnCreateTr ( oSettings, iRow, nTrIn, anTds )
1462  {

1465  rowData = row._aData,
1466  cells = [],

1468  i, iLen;

1471  {

1473

1475  row.anCells = cells;
1476

1478  * to the aoData array for fast look up
1479  */
1480  nTr._DT_RowIndex = iRow;
1481 
1482  /* Special parameters can be given by the data source to be used on the row */
1483  _fnRowAttributes( row );

1495  {
1496  nTd.innerHTML = _fnGetCellData( oSettings, iRow, i, 'display' );
1497  }

1500  if ( oCol.sClass !== null )
1501  {
1502  nTd.className += ' '+oCol.sClass;
1503  }

1511  {
1512  nTd.parentNode.removeChild( nTd );
1513  }
1514

1516  {
1517  oCol.fnCreatedCell.call( oSettings.oInstance,
1518  nTd, _fnGetCellData( oSettings, iRow, i, 'display' ), rowData, iRow, i
1519  );
1520  }
1521  }
1522 
1523  _fnCallbackFire( oSettings, 'aoRowCreatedCallback', null, [nTr, rowData, iRow] );
1524  }
1525  }

1640 
1654  function _fnDrawHead( oSettings, aoSource, bIncludeHidden )
1655  {
1656  var i, iLen, j, jLen, k, kLen, n, nLocalTr;
1657  var aoLocal = [];
1658  var aApplied = [];
1659  var iColumns = oSettings.aoColumns.length;
1660  var iRowspan, iColspan;
1661 
1662  if ( ! aoSource )
1663  {
1664  return;
1665  }
1666 
1667  if ( bIncludeHidden === undefined )
1668  {
1669  bIncludeHidden = false;
1670  }
1671 
1672  /* Make a copy of the master layout array, but without the visible columns in it */
1673  for ( i=0, iLen=aoSource.length ; i<iLen ; i++ )
1674  {
1675  aoLocal[i] = aoSource[i].slice();
1676  aoLocal[i].nTr = aoSource[i].nTr;
1677 
1678  /* Remove any columns which are currently hidden */
1679  for ( j=iColumns-1 ; j>=0 ; j-- )
1680  {
1681  if ( !oSettings.aoColumns[j].bVisible && !bIncludeHidden )
1682  {
1683  aoLocal[i].splice( j, 1 );
1684  }
1685  }
1686 
1687  /* Prep the applied array - it needs an element for each row */
1688  aApplied.push( [] );
1689  }
1690 
1691  for ( i=0, iLen=aoLocal.length ; i<iLen ; i++ )
1692  {
1693  nLocalTr = aoLocal[i].nTr;
1694 
1695  /* All cells are going to be replaced, so empty out the row */
1696  if ( nLocalTr )
1697  {
1698  while( (n = nLocalTr.firstChild) )
1699  {
1700  nLocalTr.removeChild( n );
1701  }
1702  }
1703 
1704  for ( j=0, jLen=aoLocal[i].length ; j<jLen ; j++ )
1705  {
1706  iRowspan = 1;
1707  iColspan = 1;
1708 
1709  /* Check to see if there is already a cell (row/colspan) covering our target
1710  * insert point. If there is, then there is nothing to do.
1711  */
1712  if ( aApplied[i][j] === undefined )
1713  {
1714  nLocalTr.appendChild( aoLocal[i][j].cell );
1715  aApplied[i][j] = 1;
1716 
1717  /* Expand the cell to cover as many rows as needed */
1718  while ( aoLocal[i+iRowspan] !== undefined &&
1719  aoLocal[i][j].cell == aoLocal[i+iRowspan][j].cell )
1720  {
1721  aApplied[i+iRowspan][j] = 1;
1722  iRowspan++;
1723  }
1724 
1725  /* Expand the cell to cover as many columns as needed */
1726  while ( aoLocal[i][j+iColspan] !== undefined &&
1727  aoLocal[i][j].cell == aoLocal[i][j+iColspan].cell )
1728  {
1729  /* Must update the applied array over the rows for the columns */
1730  for ( k=0 ; k<iRowspan ; k++ )
1731  {
1732  aApplied[i+k][j+iColspan] = 1;
1733  }
1734  iColspan++;
1735  }
1736 
1737  /* Do the actual expansion in the DOM */
1738  aoLocal[i][j].cell.rowSpan = iRowspan;
1739  aoLocal[i][j].cell.colSpan = iColspan;
1740  }
1741  }
1742  }
1743  }
1744 
1745 
1751  function _fnDraw( oSettings )
1752  {
1753  /* Provide a pre-callback function which can be used to cancel the draw is false is returned */
1754  var aPreDraw = _fnCallbackFire( oSettings, 'aoPreDrawCallback', 'preDraw', [oSettings] );
1755  if ( $.inArray( false, aPreDraw ) !== -1 )
1756  {
1757  _fnProcessingDisplay( oSettings, false );
1758  return;
1759  }
1760 
1761  var i, iLen, n;
1762  var anRows = [];
1763  var iRowCount = 0;
1764  var asStripeClasses = oSettings.asStripeClasses;
1765  var iStripes = asStripeClasses.length;
1766  var iOpenRows = oSettings.aoOpenRows.length;
1767  var oLang = oSettings.oLanguage;
1768  var iInitDisplayStart = oSettings.iInitDisplayStart;
1769  var bServerSide = _fnDataSource( oSettings ) == 'ssp';
1770  var aiDisplay = oSettings.aiDisplay;
1771 
1772  oSettings.bDrawing = true;
1773 
1774  /* Check and see if we have an initial draw position from state saving */
1775  if ( iInitDisplayStart !== undefined && iInitDisplayStart !== -1 )
1776  {
1777  oSettings._iDisplayStart = bServerSide ?
1778  iInitDisplayStart :
1779  iInitDisplayStart >= oSettings.fnRecordsDisplay() ?
1780  0 :
1781  iInitDisplayStart;
1782 
1783  oSettings.iInitDisplayStart = -1;
1784  }
1785 
1786  var iDisplayStart = oSettings._iDisplayStart;
1787  var iDisplayEnd = oSettings.fnDisplayEnd();
1788 
1789  /* Server-side processing draw intercept */
1790  if ( oSettings.bDeferLoading )
1791  {
1792  oSettings.bDeferLoading = false;
1793  oSettings.iDraw++;
1794  _fnProcessingDisplay( oSettings, false );
1795  }
1796  else if ( !bServerSide )
1797  {
1798  oSettings.iDraw++;
1799  }
1800  else if ( !oSettings.bDestroying && !_fnAjaxUpdate( oSettings ) )
1801  {
1802  return;
1803  }
1804 
1805  if ( aiDisplay.length !== 0 )
1806  {
1807  var iStart = bServerSide ? 0 : iDisplayStart;
1808  var iEnd = bServerSide ? oSettings.aoData.length : iDisplayEnd;
1809 
1810  for ( var j=iStart ; j<iEnd ; j++ )
1811  {
1812  var iDataIndex = aiDisplay[j];
1813  var aoData = oSettings.aoData[ iDataIndex ];
1814  if ( aoData.nTr === null )
1815  {
1816  _fnCreateTr( oSettings, iDataIndex );
1817  }
1818 
1819  var nRow = aoData.nTr;
1820 
1821  /* Remove the old striping classes and then add the new one */
1822  if ( iStripes !== 0 )
1823  {
1824  var sStripe = asStripeClasses[ iRowCount % iStripes ];
1825  if ( aoData._sRowStripe != sStripe )
1826  {
1827  $(nRow).removeClass( aoData._sRowStripe ).addClass( sStripe );
1828  aoData._sRowStripe = sStripe;
1829  }
1830  }
1831 
1832  /* Row callback functions - might want to manipulate the row */
1833  _fnCallbackFire( oSettings, 'aoRowCallback', null,
1834  [nRow, aoData._aData, iRowCount, j] );
1835 
1836  anRows.push( nRow );
1837  iRowCount++;
1838  }
1839  }
1840  else
1841  {
1842  /* Table is empty - create a row with an empty message in it */
1843  var sZero = oLang.sZeroRecords;
1844  if ( oSettings.iDraw == 1 && _fnDataSource( oSettings ) == 'ajax' )
1845  {
1846  sZero = oLang.sLoadingRecords;
1847  }
1848  else if ( oLang.sEmptyTable && oSettings.fnRecordsTotal() === 0 )
1849  {
1850  sZero = oLang.sEmptyTable;
1851  }
1852

1854  .append( $('<td />', {
1855  'valign': 'top',
1856  'colSpan': _fnVisbleColumns( oSettings ),
1857  'class': oSettings.oClasses.sRowEmpty
1858  } ).html( sZero ) )[0];
1859  }
1860 
1861  /* Header and footer callbacks */
1862  _fnCallbackFire( oSettings, 'aoHeaderCallback', 'header', [ $(oSettings.nTHead).children('tr')[0],
1863  _fnGetDataMaster( oSettings ), iDisplayStart, iDisplayEnd, aiDisplay ] );
1864 
1865  _fnCallbackFire( oSettings, 'aoFooterCallback', 'footer', [ $(oSettings.nTFoot).children('tr')[0],
1866  _fnGetDataMaster( oSettings ), iDisplayStart, iDisplayEnd, aiDisplay ] );
1867 
1868  var body = $(oSettings.nTBody);
1869 
1870  body.children().detach();
1871  body.append( $(anRows) );
1872 
1873  /* Call all required callback functions for the end of a draw */
1874  _fnCallbackFire( oSettings, 'aoDrawCallback', 'draw', [oSettings] );
1875 
1876  /* Draw is complete, sorting and filtering must be as well */
1877  oSettings.bSorted = false;
1878  oSettings.bFiltered = false;
1879  oSettings.bDrawing = false;
1880  }

1922  function _fnAddOptionsHtml ( oSettings )
1923  {
1924  /*
1925  * Create a temporary, empty, div which we can later on replace with what we have generated
1926  * we do it this way to rendering the 'options' html offline - speed :-)
1927  */
1928  var nHolding = $('<div></div>')[0];
1929  oSettings.nTable.parentNode.insertBefore( nHolding, oSettings.nTable );
1930 
1931  /*
1932  * All DataTables are wrapped in a div
1933  */
1934  oSettings.nTableWrapper = $('<div id="'+oSettings.sTableId+'_wrapper" class="'+oSettings.oClasses.sWrapper+'" role="grid"></div>')[0];
1935  oSettings.nTableReinsertBefore = oSettings.nTable.nextSibling;
1936 
1937  /* Track where we want to insert the option */
1938  var nInsertNode = oSettings.nTableWrapper;
1939 
1940  /* Loop over the user set positioning and place the elements as needed */
1941  var aDom = oSettings.sDom.split('');
1942  var nTmp, iPushFeature, cOption, nNewNode, cNext, sAttr, j;
1943  for ( var i=0 ; i<aDom.length ; i++ )
1944  {
1945  iPushFeature = 0;
1946  cOption = aDom[i];
1947 
1948  if ( cOption == '<' )
1949  {
1950  /* New container div */
1951  nNewNode = $('<div></div>')[0];
1952 
1953  /* Check to see if we should append an id and/or a class name to the container */
1954  cNext = aDom[i+1];
1955  if ( cNext == "'" || cNext == '"' )
1956  {
1957  sAttr = "";
1958  j = 2;
1959  while ( aDom[i+j] != cNext )
1960  {
1961  sAttr += aDom[i+j];
1962  j++;
1963  }
1964 
1965  /* Replace jQuery UI constants @todo depreciated */
1966  if ( sAttr == "H" )
1967  {
1968  sAttr = oSettings.oClasses.sJUIHeader;
1969  }
1970  else if ( sAttr == "F" )
1971  {
1972  sAttr = oSettings.oClasses.sJUIFooter;
1973  }
1974 
1975  /* The attribute can be in the format of "#id.class", "#id" or "class" This logic
1976  * breaks the string into parts and applies them as needed
1977  */
1978  if ( sAttr.indexOf('.') != -1 )
1979  {
1980  var aSplit = sAttr.split('.');
1981  nNewNode.id = aSplit[0].substr(1, aSplit[0].length-1);
1982  nNewNode.className = aSplit[1];
1983  }
1984  else if ( sAttr.charAt(0) == "#" )
1985  {
1986  nNewNode.id = sAttr.substr(1, sAttr.length-1);
1987  }
1988  else
1989  {
1990  nNewNode.className = sAttr;
1991  }
1992 
1993  i += j; /* Move along the position array */
1994  }
1995 
1996  nInsertNode.appendChild( nNewNode );
1997  nInsertNode = nNewNode;
1998  }
1999  else if ( cOption == '>' )
2000  {
2001  /* End container div */
2002  nInsertNode = nInsertNode.parentNode;
2003  }
2004  // @todo Move options into their own plugins?
2005  else if ( cOption == 'l' && oSettings.oFeatures.bPaginate && oSettings.oFeatures.bLengthChange )
2006  {
2007  /* Length */
2008  nTmp = _fnFeatureHtmlLength( oSettings );
2009  iPushFeature = 1;
2010  }
2011  else if ( cOption == 'f' && oSettings.oFeatures.bFilter )
2012  {
2013  /* Filter */
2014  nTmp = _fnFeatureHtmlFilter( oSettings );
2015  iPushFeature = 1;
2016  }
2017  else if ( cOption == 'r' && oSettings.oFeatures.bProcessing )
2018  {
2019  /* pRocessing */
2020  nTmp = _fnFeatureHtmlProcessing( oSettings );
2021  iPushFeature = 1;
2022  }
2023  else if ( cOption == 't' )
2024  {
2025  /* Table */
2026  nTmp = _fnFeatureHtmlTable( oSettings );
2027  iPushFeature = 1;
2028  }
2029  else if ( cOption == 'i' && oSettings.oFeatures.bInfo )
2030  {
2031  /* Info */
2032  nTmp = _fnFeatureHtmlInfo( oSettings );
2033  iPushFeature = 1;
2034  }
2035  else if ( cOption == 'p' && oSettings.oFeatures.bPaginate )
2036  {
2037  /* Pagination */
2038  nTmp = _fnFeatureHtmlPaginate( oSettings );
2039  iPushFeature = 1;
2040  }
2041  else if ( DataTable.ext.feature.length !== 0 )
2042  {
2043  /* Plug-in features */
2044  var aoFeatures = DataTable.ext.feature;
2045  for ( var k=0, kLen=aoFeatures.length ; k<kLen ; k++ )
2046  {
2047  if ( cOption == aoFeatures[k].cFeature )
2048  {
2049  nTmp = aoFeatures[k].fnInit( oSettings );
2050  if ( nTmp )
2051  {
2052  iPushFeature = 1;
2053  }
2054  break;
2055  }
2056  }
2057  }
2058 
2059  /* Add to the 2D features array */
2060  if ( iPushFeature == 1 && nTmp !== null )
2061  {
2062  if ( typeof oSettings.aanFeatures[cOption] !== 'object' )
2063  {
2064  oSettings.aanFeatures[cOption] = [];
2065  }
2066  oSettings.aanFeatures[cOption].push( nTmp );
2067  nInsertNode.appendChild( nTmp );
2068  }
2069  }
2070 
2071  /* Built our DOM structure - replace the holding div with what we want */
2072  nHolding.parentNode.replaceChild( oSettings.nTableWrapper, nHolding );
2073  }

2075 
2085  function _fnDetectHeader ( aLayout, nThead )
2086  {
2087  var nTrs = $(nThead).children('tr');
2088  var nTr, nCell;
2089  var i, k, l, iLen, jLen, iColShifted, iColumn, iColspan, iRowspan;
2090  var bUnique;
2091  var fnShiftCol = function ( a, i, j ) {
2092  var k = a[i];
2093  while ( k[j] ) {
2094  j++;
2095  }
2096  return j;
2097  };
2098 
2099  aLayout.splice( 0, aLayout.length );
2100 
2101  /* We know how many rows there are in the layout - so prep it */
2102  for ( i=0, iLen=nTrs.length ; i<iLen ; i++ )
2103  {
2104  aLayout.push( [] );
2105  }
2106 
2107  /* Calculate a layout array */
2108  for ( i=0, iLen=nTrs.length ; i<iLen ; i++ )
2109  {
2110  nTr = nTrs[i];
2111  iColumn = 0;
2112 
2113  /* For every cell in the row... */
2114  nCell = nTr.firstChild;
2115  while ( nCell ) {
2116  if ( nCell.nodeName.toUpperCase() == "TD" ||
2117  nCell.nodeName.toUpperCase() == "TH" )
2118  {
2119  /* Get the col and rowspan attributes from the DOM and sanitise them */
2120  iColspan = nCell.getAttribute('colspan') * 1;
2121  iRowspan = nCell.getAttribute('rowspan') * 1;
2122  iColspan = (!iColspan || iColspan===0 || iColspan===1) ? 1 : iColspan;
2123  iRowspan = (!iRowspan || iRowspan===0 || iRowspan===1) ? 1 : iRowspan;
2124 
2125  /* There might be colspan cells already in this row, so shift our target
2126  * accordingly
2127  */
2128  iColShifted = fnShiftCol( aLayout, i, iColumn );
2129 
2130  /* Cache calculation for unique columns */
2131  bUnique = iColspan === 1 ? true : false;
2132 
2133  /* If there is col / rowspan, copy the information into the layout grid */
2134  for ( l=0 ; l<iColspan ; l++ )
2135  {
2136  for ( k=0 ; k<iRowspan ; k++ )
2137  {
2138  aLayout[i+k][iColShifted+l] = {
2139  "cell": nCell,
2140  "unique": bUnique
2141  };
2142  aLayout[i+k].nTr = nTr;
2143  }
2144  }
2145  }
2146  nCell = nCell.nextSibling;
2147  }
2148  }
2149  }
2150

2160  function _fnGetUniqueThs ( oSettings, nHeader, aLayout )
2161  {
2162  var aReturn = [];
2163  if ( !aLayout )
2164  {
2165  aLayout = oSettings.aoHeader;
2166  if ( nHeader )
2167  {
2168  aLayout = [];
2169  _fnDetectHeader( aLayout, nHeader );
2170  }
2171  }
2172 
2173  for ( var i=0, iLen=aLayout.length ; i<iLen ; i++ )
2174  {
2175  for ( var j=0, jLen=aLayout[i].length ; j<jLen ; j++ )
2176  {
2177  if ( aLayout[i][j].unique &&
2178  (!aReturn[j] || !oSettings.bSortCellsTop) )
2179  {
2180  aReturn[j] = aLayout[i][j].cell;
2181  }
2182  }
2183  }
2184 
2185  return aReturn;
2186  }

2199  function _fnBuildAjax( oSettings, data, fn )
2200  {
2201  // Compatibility with 1.9-, allow fnServerData and event to manipulate
2202  _fnCallbackFire( oSettings, 'aoServerParams', 'serverParams', [data] );
2203 
2204  // Convert to object based for 1.10+ if using the old scheme
2205  if ( data && data.__legacy ) {
2206  var tmp = {};
2207  var rbracket = /(.*?)\[\]$/;
2208 
2209  $.each( data, function (key, val) {
2210  var match = val.name.match(rbracket);
2211 
2212  if ( match ) {
2213  // Support for arrays
2214  var name = match[0];
2215 
2216  if ( ! tmp[ name ] ) {
2217  tmp[ name ] = [];
2218  }
2219  tmp[ name ].push( val.value );
2220  }
2221  else {
2222  tmp[val.name] = val.value;
2223  }
2224  } );
2225  data = tmp;
2226  }
2227 
2228  var ajaxData;
2229  var ajax = oSettings.ajax;
2230  var instance = oSettings.oInstance;
2231 
2232  if ( $.isPlainObject( ajax ) && ajax.data )
2233  {
2234  ajaxData = ajax.data;
2235 
2236  var newData = $.isFunction( ajaxData ) ?
2237  ajaxData( data ) : // fn can manipulate data or return an object
2238  ajaxData; // object or array to merge
2239 
2240  // If the function returned an object, use that alone
2241  data = $.isFunction( ajaxData ) && newData ?
2242  newData :
2243  $.extend( true, data, newData );
2244 
2245  // Remove the data property as we've resolved it already and don't want
2246  // jQuery to do it again (it is restored at the end of the function)
2247  delete ajax.data;
2248  }
2249 
2250  var baseAjax = {
2251  "data": data,
2252  "success": function (json) {
2253  var error = json.error || json.sError;
2254  if ( error ) {
2255  oSettings.oApi._fnLog( oSettings, 0, error );
2256  }
2257 
2258  oSettings.json = json;
2259  _fnCallbackFire( oSettings, null, 'xhr', [oSettings, json] );
2260  fn( json );
2261  },
2262  "dataType": "json",
2263  "cache": false,
2264  "type": oSettings.sServerMethod,
2265  "error": function (xhr, error, thrown) {
2266  var log = oSettings.oApi._fnLog;
2267 
2268  if ( error == "parsererror" ) {
2269  log( oSettings, 0, 'Invalid JSON response', 1 );
2270  }
2271  else {
2272  log( oSettings, 0, 'Ajax error', 7 );
2273  }
2274  }
2275  };
2276 
2277  if ( oSettings.fnServerData )
2278  {
2279  // DataTables 1.9- compatibility
2280  oSettings.fnServerData.call( instance,
2281  oSettings.sAjaxSource, data, fn, oSettings
2282  );
2283  }
2284  else if ( oSettings.sAjaxSource || typeof ajax === 'string' )
2285  {
2286  // DataTables 1.9- compatibility
2287  oSettings.jqXHR = $.ajax( $.extend( baseAjax, {
2288  url: ajax || oSettings.sAjaxSource
2289  } ) );
2290  }
2291  else if ( $.isFunction( ajax ) )
2292  {
2293  // Is a function - let the caller define what needs to be done
2294  oSettings.jqXHR = ajax.call( instance, data, fn, oSettings );
2295  }
2296  else
2297  {
2298  // Object to extend the base settings
2299  oSettings.jqXHR = $.ajax( $.extend( baseAjax, ajax ) );
2300 
2301  // Restore for next time around
2302  ajax.data = ajaxData;
2303  }
2304  }

2325

2343  function _fnAjaxParameters( settings )
2344  {
2345  var
2346  columns = settings.aoColumns,
2347  columnCount = columns.length,
2348  features = settings.oFeatures,
2349  preSearch = settings.oPreviousSearch,
2350  preColSearch = settings.aoPreSearchCols,
2351  i, data = [], dataProp, column, columnSearch,
2352  sort = _fnSortFlatten( settings ),
2353  displayStart = settings._iDisplayStart,
2354  displayLength = features.bPaginate !== false ?
2355  settings._iDisplayLength :
2356  -1;
2357 
2358  var param = function ( name, value ) {
2359  data.push( { 'name': name, 'value': value } );
2360  };
2361 
2362  // DataTables 1.9- compatible method
2363  param( 'sEcho', settings.iDraw );
2364  param( 'iColumns', columnCount );
2365  param( 'sColumns', _pluck( columns, 'sName' ).join(',') );
2366  param( 'iDisplayStart', displayStart );
2367  param( 'iDisplayLength', displayLength );
2368 
2369  // DataTables 1.10+ method
2370  var d = {
2371  draw: settings.iDraw,
2372  columns: [],
2373  order: [],
2374  start: displayStart,
2375  length: displayLength,
2376  search: {
2377  value: preSearch.sSearch,
2378  regex: preSearch.bRegex
2379  }
2380  };
2381 
2382  for ( i=0 ; i<columnCount ; i++ ) {
2383  column = columns[i];
2384  columnSearch = preColSearch[i];
2385  dataProp = typeof column.mData=="function" ? 'function' : column.mData ;
2386 
2387  d.columns.push( {
2388  data: dataProp,
2389  name: column.sName,
2390  searchable: column.bSearchable,
2391  orderable: column.bSortable,
2392  search: {
2393  value: columnSearch.sSearch,
2394  regex: columnSearch.bRegex
2395  }
2396  } );
2397 
2398  param( "mDataProp_"+i, dataProp );
2399 
2400  if ( features.bFilter ) {
2401  param( 'sSearch_'+i, columnSearch.sSearch );
2402  param( 'bRegex_'+i, columnSearch.bRegex );
2403  param( 'bSearchable_'+i, column.bSearchable );
2404  }
2405 
2406  if ( features.bSort ) {
2407  param( 'bSortable_'+i, column.bSortable );
2408  }
2409  }
2410 
2411  $.each( sort, function ( i, val ) {
2412  d.order.push( { column: val.col, dir: val.dir } );
2413 
2414  param( 'iSortCol_'+i, val.col );
2415  param( 'sSortDir_'+i, val.dir );
2416  } );
2417 
2418  if ( features.bFilter ) {
2419  param( 'sSearch', preSearch.sSearch );
2420  param( 'bRegex', preSearch.bRegex );
2421  }
2422 
2423  if ( features.bSort ) {
2424  param( 'iSortingCols', sort.length );
2425  }
2426 
2427  data.__legacy = true;
2428  return settings.sAjaxSource || DataTable.ext.legacy.ajax ?
2429  data : d;
2430  }

2444  function _fnAjaxUpdateDraw ( settings, json )
2445  {
2446  // v1.10 uses camelCase variables, while 1.9 uses Hungarian notation.
2447  // Support both
2448  var compat = function ( old, modern ) {
2449  return json[old] !== undefined ? json[old] : json[modern];
2450  };
2451 
2452  var draw = compat( 'sEcho', 'draw' );
2453  var recordsTotal = compat( 'iTotalRecords', 'recordsTotal' );
2454  var rocordsFiltered = compat( 'iTotalDisplayRecords', 'recordsFiltered' );
2455 
2456  if ( draw ) {
2457  // Protect against out of sequence returns
2458  if ( draw*1 < settings.iDraw ) {
2459  return;
2460  }
2461  settings.iDraw = draw * 1;
2462  }
2463 
2464  _fnClearTable( settings );
2465  settings._iRecordsTotal = parseInt(recordsTotal, 10);
2466  settings._iRecordsDisplay = parseInt(rocordsFiltered, 10);

2470  _fnAddData( settings, data[i] );
2471  }
2472  settings.aiDisplay = settings.aiDisplayMaster.slice();
2473 
2474  settings.bAjaxDataGet = false;
2475  _fnDraw( settings );
2476 
2477  if ( ! settings._bInitComplete ) {
2478  _fnInitComplete( settings, json );
2479  }
2480 
2481  settings.bAjaxDataGet = true;
2482  _fnProcessingDisplay( settings, false );

2497  oSettings.ajax.dataSrc :
2498  oSettings.sAjaxDataProp; // Compatibility with 1.9-.
2499 
2500  // Compatibility with 1.9-. In order to read from aaData, check if the
2501  // default has been changed, if not, check for aaData
2502  if ( dataSrc === 'data' ) {
2503  return json.aaData || json[dataSrc];
2504  }

2518  function _fnFeatureHtmlFilter ( settings )

2589  function _fnFilterComplete ( oSettings, oInput, iForce )
2590  {

2592  var aoPrevSearch = oSettings.aoPreSearchCols;
2593  var fnSaveFilter = function ( oFilter ) {

2596  oPrevSearch.bRegex = oFilter.bRegex;
2597  oPrevSearch.bSmart = oFilter.bSmart;
2598  oPrevSearch.bCaseInsensitive = oFilter.bCaseInsensitive;
2599  };
2600

2602  // @todo As per sort - can this be moved into an event handler?
2603  _fnColumnTypes( oSettings );

2606  if ( _fnDataSource( oSettings ) != 'ssp' )
2607  {

2609  _fnFilter( oSettings, oInput.sSearch, iForce, oInput.bRegex, oInput.bSmart, oInput.bCaseInsensitive );
2610  fnSaveFilter( oInput );
2611 
2612  /* Now do the individual column filter */
2613  for ( var i=0 ; i<aoPrevSearch.length ; i++ )
2614  {
2615  _fnFilterColumn( oSettings, aoPrevSearch[i].sSearch, i, aoPrevSearch[i].bRegex,
2616  aoPrevSearch[i].bSmart, aoPrevSearch[i].bCaseInsensitive );
2617  }
2618

2620  _fnFilterCustom( oSettings );
2621  }
2622  else
2623  {
2624  fnSaveFilter( oInput );
2625  }
2626 
2627  /* Tell the draw function we have been filtering */
2628  oSettings.bFiltered = true;
2629  _fnCallbackFire( oSettings, null, 'search', [oSettings] );
2630  }

2676  function _fnFilterColumn ( settings, searchStr, colIdx, regex, smart, caseInsensitive )
2677  {

2679  return;

2695 
2706  function _fnFilter( settings, input, force, regex, smart, caseInsensitive )
2707  {
2708  var rpSearch = _fnFilterCreateSearch( input, regex, smart, caseInsensitive );
2709  var prevSearch = settings.oPreviousSearch.sSearch;
2710  var displayMaster = settings.aiDisplayMaster;
2711  var display, invalidated, i;
2712 
2713  // Need to take account of custom filtering functions - always filter
2714  if ( DataTable.ext.search.length !== 0 ) {
2715  force = true;
2716  }
2717 
2718  // Check if any of the rows were invalidated
2719  invalidated = _fnFilterData( settings );
2720 
2721  // If the input is blank - we just want the full data set
2722  if ( input.length <= 0 ) {
2723  settings.aiDisplay = displayMaster.slice();
2724  }
2725  else {
2726  // New search - start from the master array
2727  if ( invalidated ||
2728  force ||
2729  prevSearch.length > input.length ||
2730  input.indexOf(prevSearch) !== 0 ||
2731  settings.bSorted // On resort, the display master needs to be
2732  // re-filtered since indexes will have changed
2733  ) {
2734  settings.aiDisplay = displayMaster.slice();
2735  }
2736 
2737  // Search the display array
2738  display = settings.aiDisplay;
2739 
2740  for ( i=display.length-1 ; i>=0 ; i-- ) {
2741  if ( ! rpSearch.test( settings.aoData[ display[i] ]._sFilterRow ) ) {
2742  display.splice( i, 1 );
2743  }
2744  }
2745  }
2746  }

2758  function _fnFilterCreateSearch( sSearch, bRegex, bSmart, bCaseInsensitive )
2759  {
2760  var asSearch,
2761  sRegExpString = bRegex ? sSearch : _fnEscapeRegex( sSearch );
2762 
2763  if ( bSmart )
2764  {
2765  /* Generate the regular expression to use. Something along the lines of:
2766  * ^(?=.*?\bone\b)(?=.*?\btwo\b)(?=.*?\bthree\b).*$
2767  */
2768  asSearch = sRegExpString.split( ' ' );
2769  sRegExpString = '^(?=.*?'+asSearch.join( ')(?=.*?' )+').*$';
2770  }
2771 
2772  return new RegExp( sRegExpString, bCaseInsensitive ? "i" : "" );
2773  }
2774 
2775 
2782  function _fnEscapeRegex ( sVal )
2783  {
2784  var acEscape = [ '/', '.', '*', '+', '?', '|', '(', ')', '[', ']', '{', '}', '\\', '$', '^', '-' ];
2785  var reReplace = new RegExp( '(\\' + acEscape.join('|\\') + ')', 'g' );
2786  return sVal.replace(reReplace, '\\$1');
2787  }

2792  var __filter_div_textContent = __filter_div.textContent !== undefined;
2793 
2794  // Update the filtering data for each row if needed (by invalidation or first run)
2795  function _fnFilterData ( settings )
2796  {
2797  var columns = settings.aoColumns;
2798  var column;
2799  var i, j, ien, jen, filterData, cellData, row;
2800  var fomatters = DataTable.ext.type.search;
2801  var wasInvalidated = false;
2802 
2803  for ( i=0, ien=settings.aoData.length ; i<ien ; i++ ) {
2804  row = settings.aoData[i];
2805 
2806  if ( ! row._aFilterData ) {
2807  filterData = [];
2808 
2809  for ( j=0, jen=columns.length ; j<jen ; j++ ) {
2810  column = columns[j];
2811 
2812  if ( column.bSearchable ) {
2813  cellData = _fnGetCellData( settings, i, j, 'filter' );
2814 
2815  cellData = fomatters[ column.sType ] ?
2816  fomatters[ column.sType ]( cellData ) :
2817  cellData !== null ?
2818  cellData :
2819  '';
2820  }
2821  else {
2822  cellData = '';
2823  }
2824 
2825  // If it looks like there is an HTML entity in the string,
2826  // attempt to decode it so sorting works as expected. Note that
2827  // we could use a single line of jQuery to do this, but the DOM
2828  // method used here is much faster http://jsperf.com/html-decode
2829  if ( cellData.indexOf && cellData.indexOf('&') !== -1 ) {
2830  __filter_div.innerHTML = cellData;
2831  cellData = __filter_div_textContent ?
2832  __filter_div.textContent :
2833  __filter_div.innerText;
2834  cellData = cellData.replace(/[\r\n]/g, '');
2835  }
2836 
2837  filterData.push( cellData );
2838  }
2839 
2840  row._aFilterData = filterData;
2841  row._sFilterRow = filterData.join(' ');
2842  wasInvalidated = true;
2843  }
2844  }
2845 
2846  return wasInvalidated;
2847  }

3189  function _fnPageChange ( settings, action, redraw )
3190  {
3191  var
3192  start = settings._iDisplayStart,
3193  len = settings._iDisplayLength,
3194  records = settings.fnRecordsDisplay();
3195 
3196  if ( records === 0 || len === -1 )
3197  {
3198  start = 0;
3199  }
3200  else if ( typeof action === "number" )
3201  {
3202  start = action * len;
3203 
3204  if ( start > records )
3205  {
3206  start = 0;
3207  }
3208  }
3209  else if ( action == "first" )
3210  {
3211  start = 0;
3212  }
3213  else if ( action == "previous" )
3214  {
3215  start = len >= 0 ?
3216  start - len :
3217  0;
3218 
3219  if ( start < 0 )
3220  {
3221  start = 0;
3222  }
3223  }
3224  else if ( action == "next" )
3225  {
3226  if ( start + len < records )
3227  {
3228  start += len;
3229  }
3230  }
3231  else if ( action == "last" )
3232  {
3233  start = Math.floor( (records-1) / len) * len;
3234  }
3235  else
3236  {
3237  _fnLog( settings, 0, "Unknown paging action: "+action, 5 );
3238  }
3239 
3240  var changed = settings._iDisplayStart !== start;
3241  settings._iDisplayStart = start;
3242 
3243  _fnCallbackFire( settings, null, 'page', [settings] );
3244 
3245  if ( redraw ) {
3246  _fnDraw( settings );
3247  }
3248 
3249  return changed;
3250  }

3292  function _fnFeatureHtmlTable ( settings )
3293  {

3298  }
3299 
3300  var scrollX = scroll.sX;
3301  var scrollY = scroll.sY;

3303  var table = $(settings.nTable);
3304  var caption = table.children('caption');
3305  var captionSide = caption.length ? caption[0]._captionSide : null;
3306  var headerClone = $( table[0].cloneNode(false) );

3314  if ( ! footer.length ) {

3317 
3318  /*
3319  * The HTML structure that we want to generate in this function is:
3320  * div - scroller
3321  * div - scroll head
3322  * div - scroll head inner
3323  * table - scroll head table
3324  * thead - thead
3325  * div - scroll body

3328  * tbody - tbody
3329  * div - scroll foot
3330  * div - scroll foot inner
3331  * table - scroll foot table
3332  * tfoot - tfoot
3333  */
3334  var scroller = $( _div, { 'class': classes.sScrollWrapper } )
3335  .append(
3336  $(_div, { 'class': classes.sScrollHead } )
3337  .css( {
3338  overflow: 'hidden',
3339  position: 'relative',
3340  border: 0,
3341  width: scrollX ? size(scrollX) : '100%'
3342  } )
3343  .append(
3344  $(_div, { 'class': classes.sScrollHeadInner } )
3345  .css( {
3346  'box-sizing': 'content-box',
3347  width: scroll.sXInner || '100%'
3348  } )
3349  .append(
3350  headerClone
3351  .removeAttr('id')
3352  .css( 'margin-left', 0 )
3353  .append(
3354  table.children('thead')
3355  )
3356  )
3357  )
3358  .append( captionSide === 'top' ? caption : null )
3359  )
3360  .append(
3361  $(_div, { 'class': classes.sScrollBody } )
3362  .css( {
3363  overflow: 'auto',
3364  height: size( scrollY ),
3365  width: size( scrollX )
3366  } )
3367  .append( table )
3368  );
3369 
3370  if ( footer ) {
3371  scroller.append(
3372  $(_div, { 'class': classes.sScrollFoot } )
3373  .css( {
3374  overflow: 'hidden',
3375  border: 0,
3376  width: scrollX ? size(scrollX) : '100%'
3377  } )
3378  .append(
3379  $(_div, { 'class': classes.sScrollFootInner } )
3380  .append(
3381  footerClone
3382  .removeAttr('id')
3383  .css( 'margin-left', 0 )
3384  .append(
3385  table.children('tfoot')
3386  )
3387  )
3388  )
3389  .append( captionSide === 'bottom' ? caption : null )
3390  );
3391  }
3392 
3393  var children = scroller.children();
3394  var scrollHead = children[0];
3395  var scrollBody = children[1];
3396  var scrollFoot = footer ? children[2] : null;
3397 
3398  // When the body is scrolled, then we also want to scroll the headers
3399  if ( scrollX ) {
3400  $(scrollBody).scroll( function (e) {
3401  var scrollLeft = this.scrollLeft;
3402 
3403  scrollHead.scrollLeft = scrollLeft;
3404 
3405  if ( footer ) {
3406  scrollFoot.scrollLeft = scrollLeft;
3407  }
3408  } );
3409  }
3410 
3411  settings.nScrollHead = scrollHead;
3412  settings.nScrollBody = scrollBody;
3413  settings.nScrollFoot = scrollFoot;
3414 
3415  // On redraw - align columns
3416  settings.aoDrawCallback.push( {
3417  "fn": _fnScrollDraw,
3418  "sName": "scrolling"
3419  } );
3420 
3421  return scroller[0];
3422  }

3440  function _fnScrollDraw ( settings )
3441  {
3442  // Given that this is such a monster function, a lot of variables are use
3443  // to try and keep the minimised size as small as possible
3444  var
3445  scroll = settings.oScroll,
3446  scrollX = scroll.sX,
3447  scrollXInner = scroll.sXInner,
3448  scrollY = scroll.sY,
3449  barWidth = scroll.iBarWidth,
3450  divHeader = $(settings.nScrollHead),
3451  divHeaderStyle = divHeader[0].style,
3452  divHeaderInner = divHeader.children('div'),
3453  divHeaderInnerStyle = divHeaderInner[0].style,
3454  divHeaderTable = divHeaderInner.children('table'),
3455  divBodyEl = settings.nScrollBody,
3456  divBody = $(divBodyEl),
3457  divBodyStyle = divBodyEl.style,
3458  divFooter = $(settings.nScrollFoot),
3459  divFooterInner = divFooter.children('div'),
3460  divFooterTable = divFooterInner.children('table'),
3461  header = $(settings.nTHead),
3462  table = $(settings.nTable),
3463  tableEl = table[0],
3464  tableStyle = tableEl.style,
3465  footer = settings.nTFoot ? $(settings.nTFoot) : null,
3466  browser = settings.oBrowser,
3467  ie67 = browser.bScrollOversize,
3468  headerTrgEls, footerTrgEls,
3469  headerSrcEls, footerSrcEls,
3470  headerCopy, footerCopy,
3471  headerWidths=[], footerWidths=[],
3472  idx, correction, sanityWidth,
3473  zeroOut = function(nSizer) {
3474  var style = nSizer.style;
3475  style.paddingTop = "0";
3476  style.paddingBottom = "0";
3477  style.borderTopWidth = "0";
3478  style.borderBottomWidth = "0";
3479  style.height = 0;
3480  };
3481 
3482  /*
3483  * 1. Re-create the table inside the scrolling div
3484  */
3485 
3486  // Remove the old minimised thead and tfoot elements in the inner table
3487  table.children('thead, tfoot').remove();
3488 
3489  // Clone the current header and footer elements and then place it into the inner table
3490  headerCopy = header.clone().prependTo( table );
3491  headerTrgEls = header.find('tr'); // original header is in its own table
3492  headerSrcEls = headerCopy.find('tr');
3493  headerCopy.find('th, td').removeAttr('tabindex');
3494 
3495  if ( footer ) {
3496  footerCopy = footer.clone().prependTo( table );
3497  footerTrgEls = footer.find('tr'); // the original tfoot is in its own table and must be sized
3498  footerSrcEls = footerCopy.find('tr');
3499  }
3500 
3501 
3502  /*
3503  * 2. Take live measurements from the DOM - do not alter the DOM itself!
3504  */
3505 
3506  // Remove old sizing and apply the calculated column widths
3507  // Get the unique column headers in the newly created (cloned) header. We want to apply the
3508  // calculated sizes to this header
3509  if ( ! scrollX )
3510  {
3511  divBodyStyle.width = '100%';
3512  divHeader[0].style.width = '100%';
3513  }
3514 
3515  $.each( _fnGetUniqueThs( settings, headerCopy ), function ( i, el ) {
3516  idx = _fnVisibleToColumnIndex( settings, i );
3517  el.style.width = settings.aoColumns[idx].sWidth;
3518  } );
3519 
3520  if ( footer ) {
3521  _fnApplyToChildren( function(n) {
3522  n.style.width = "";
3523  }, footerSrcEls );
3524  }
3525 
3526  // If scroll collapse is enabled, when we put the headers back into the body for sizing, we
3527  // will end up forcing the scrollbar to appear, making our measurements wrong for when we
3528  // then hide it (end of this function), so add the header height to the body scroller.
3529  if ( scroll.bCollapse && scrollY !== "" ) {
3530  divBodyStyle.height = (divBody.offsetHeight + header[0].offsetHeight)+"px";
3531  }
3532 
3533  // Size the table as a whole
3534  sanityWidth = table.outerWidth();
3535  if ( scrollX === "" ) {
3536  // No x scrolling
3537  tableStyle.width = "100%";
3538 
3539  // IE7 will make the width of the table when 100% include the scrollbar
3540  // - which is shouldn't. When there is a scrollbar we need to take this
3541  // into account.
3542  if ( ie67 && (table.find('tbody').height() > divBodyEl.offsetHeight ||
3543  divBody.css('overflow-y') == "scroll")
3544  ) {
3545  tableStyle.width = _fnStringToCss( table.outerWidth() - barWidth);
3546  }
3547  }
3548  else
3549  {
3550  // x scrolling
3551  if ( scrollXInner !== "" ) {
3552  // x scroll inner has been given - use it
3553  tableStyle.width = _fnStringToCss(scrollXInner);
3554  }
3555  else if ( sanityWidth == divBody.width() && divBody.height() < table.height() ) {
3556  // There is y-scrolling - try to take account of the y scroll bar
3557  tableStyle.width = _fnStringToCss( sanityWidth-barWidth );
3558  if ( table.outerWidth() > sanityWidth-barWidth ) {
3559  // Not possible to take account of it
3560  tableStyle.width = _fnStringToCss( sanityWidth );
3561  }
3562  }
3563  else {
3564  // When all else fails
3565  tableStyle.width = _fnStringToCss( sanityWidth );
3566  }
3567  }
3568 
3569  // Recalculate the sanity width - now that we've applied the required width,
3570  // before it was a temporary variable. This is required because the column
3571  // width calculation is done before this table DOM is created.
3572  sanityWidth = table.outerWidth();
3573 
3574  // Hidden header should have zero height, so remove padding and borders. Then
3575  // set the width based on the real headers
3576 
3577  // Apply all styles in one pass
3578  _fnApplyToChildren( zeroOut, headerSrcEls );
3579 
3580  // Read all widths in next pass
3581  _fnApplyToChildren( function(nSizer) {
3582  headerWidths.push( _fnStringToCss( $(nSizer).css('width') ) );
3583  }, headerSrcEls );
3584 
3585  // Apply all widths in final pass
3586  _fnApplyToChildren( function(nToSize, i) {
3587  nToSize.style.width = headerWidths[i];
3588  }, headerTrgEls );
3589 
3590  $(headerSrcEls).height(0);
3591 
3592  /* Same again with the footer if we have one */
3593  if ( footer )
3594  {
3595  _fnApplyToChildren( zeroOut, footerSrcEls );
3596 
3597  _fnApplyToChildren( function(nSizer) {
3598  footerWidths.push( _fnStringToCss( $(nSizer).css('width') ) );
3599  }, footerSrcEls );
3600 
3601  _fnApplyToChildren( function(nToSize, i) {
3602  nToSize.style.width = footerWidths[i];
3603  }, footerTrgEls );
3604 
3605  $(footerSrcEls).height(0);
3606  }
3607 
3608 
3609  /*
3610  * 3. Apply the measurements
3611  */
3612 
3613  // "Hide" the header and footer that we used for the sizing. We want to also fix their width
3614  // to what they currently are
3615  _fnApplyToChildren( function(nSizer, i) {
3616  nSizer.innerHTML = "";
3617  nSizer.style.width = headerWidths[i];
3618  }, headerSrcEls );
3619 
3620  if ( footer )
3621  {
3622  _fnApplyToChildren( function(nSizer, i) {
3623  nSizer.innerHTML = "";
3624  nSizer.style.width = footerWidths[i];
3625  }, footerSrcEls );
3626  }
3627 
3628  // Sanity check that the table is of a sensible width. If not then we are going to get
3629  // misalignment - try to prevent this by not allowing the table to shrink below its min width
3630  if ( table.outerWidth() < sanityWidth )
3631  {
3632  // The min width depends upon if we have a vertical scrollbar visible or not */
3633  correction = ((divBodyEl.scrollHeight > divBodyEl.offsetHeight ||
3634  divBody.css('overflow-y') == "scroll")) ?
3635  sanityWidth+barWidth :
3636  sanityWidth;
3637 
3638  // IE6/7 are a law unto themselves...
3639  if ( ie67 && (divBodyEl.scrollHeight >
3640  divBodyEl.offsetHeight || divBody.css('overflow-y') == "scroll")
3641  ) {
3642  tableStyle.width = _fnStringToCss( correction-barWidth );
3643  }
3644 
3645  // And give the user a warning that we've stopped the table getting too small
3646  if ( scrollX === "" || scrollXInner !== "" ) {
3647  _fnLog( settings, 1, 'Possible column misalignment', 6 );
3648  }
3649  }
3650  else
3651  {
3652  correction = '100%';
3653  }
3654 
3655  // Apply to the container elements
3656  divBodyStyle.width = _fnStringToCss( correction );
3657  divHeaderStyle.width = _fnStringToCss( correction );
3658 
3659  if ( footer ) {
3660  settings.nScrollFoot.style.width = _fnStringToCss( correction );
3661  }
3662 
3663 
3664  /*
3665  * 4. Clean up
3666  */
3667  if ( ! scrollY ) {
3668  /* IE7< puts a vertical scrollbar in place (when it shouldn't be) due to subtracting
3669  * the scrollbar height from the visible display, rather than adding it on. We need to
3670  * set the height in order to sort this. Don't want to do it in any other browsers.
3671  */
3672  if ( ie67 ) {
3673  divBodyStyle.height = _fnStringToCss( tableEl.offsetHeight+barWidth );
3674  }
3675  }
3676 
3677  if ( scrollY && scroll.bCollapse ) {
3678  divBodyStyle.height = _fnStringToCss( scrollY );
3679 
3680  var iExtra = (scrollX && tableEl.offsetWidth > divBodyEl.offsetWidth) ?
3681  barWidth :
3682  0;
3683 
3684  if ( tableEl.offsetHeight < divBodyEl.offsetHeight ) {
3685  divBodyStyle.height = _fnStringToCss( tableEl.offsetHeight+iExtra );
3686  }
3687  }
3688 
3689  /* Finally set the width's of the header and footer tables */
3690  var iOuterWidth = table.outerWidth();
3691  divHeaderTable[0].style.width = _fnStringToCss( iOuterWidth );
3692  divHeaderInnerStyle.width = _fnStringToCss( iOuterWidth );
3693 
3694  // Figure out if there are scrollbar present - if so then we need a the header and footer to
3695  // provide a bit more space to allow "overflow" scrolling (i.e. past the scrollbar)
3696  var bScrolling = table.height() > divBodyEl.clientHeight || divBody.css('overflow-y') == "scroll";
3697  var padding = 'padding' + (browser.bScrollbarLeft ? 'Left' : 'Right' );
3698  divHeaderInnerStyle[ padding ] = bScrolling ? barWidth+"px" : "0px";
3699 
3700  if ( footer ) {
3701  divFooterTable[0].style.width = _fnStringToCss( iOuterWidth );
3702  divFooterInner[0].style.width = _fnStringToCss( iOuterWidth );
3703  divFooterInner[0].style[padding] = bScrolling ? barWidth+"px" : "0px";
3704  }
3705 
3706  /* Adjust the position of the header in case we loose the y-scrollbar */
3707  divBody.scroll();
3708 
3709  /* If sorting or filtering has occurred, jump the scrolling back to the top */
3710  if ( settings.bSorted || settings.bFiltered ) {
3711  divBodyEl.scrollTop = 0;
3712  }
3713  }

3716 
3725  function _fnApplyToChildren( fn, an1, an2 )
3726  {
3727  var index=0, i=0, iLen=an1.length;
3728  var nNode1, nNode2;
3729 
3730  while ( i < iLen ) {
3731  nNode1 = an1[i].firstChild;
3732  nNode2 = an2 ? an2[i].firstChild : null;
3733 
3734  while ( nNode1 ) {
3735  if ( nNode1.nodeType === 1 ) {
3736  if ( an2 ) {
3737  fn( nNode1, nNode2, index );
3738  }
3739  else {
3740  fn( nNode1, index );
3741  }
3742 
3743  index++;
3744  }
3745 
3746  nNode1 = nNode1.nextSibling;
3747  nNode2 = an2 ? nNode2.nextSibling : null;
3748  }
3749 
3750  i++;
3751  }
3752  }
3753 
3754 
3755 
3756  var __re_html_remove = /<.*?>/g;
3757 
3758 
3764  function _fnCalculateColumnWidths ( oSettings )
3765  {
3766  var
3767  table = oSettings.nTable,
3768  columns = oSettings.aoColumns,
3769  scroll = oSettings.oScroll,
3770  scrollY = scroll.sY,
3771  scrollX = scroll.sX,
3772  scrollXInner = scroll.sXInner,
3773  columnCount = columns.length,
3774  visibleColumns = _fnGetColumns( oSettings, 'bVisible' ),
3775  headerCells = $('th', oSettings.nTHead),
3776  tableWidthAttr = table.getAttribute('width'),
3777  tableContainer = table.parentNode,
3778  userInputs = false,
3779  i, column, columnIdx, width, outerWidth;
3780 
3781  /* Convert any user input sizes into pixel sizes */
3782  for ( i=0 ; i<visibleColumns.length ; i++ ) {
3783  column = columns[ visibleColumns[i] ];
3784 
3785  if ( column.sWidth !== null ) {
3786  column.sWidth = _fnConvertToWidth( column.sWidthOrig, tableContainer );
3787 
3788  userInputs = true;
3789  }
3790  }
3791 
3792  /* If the number of columns in the DOM equals the number that we have to
3793  * process in DataTables, then we can use the offsets that are created by
3794  * the web- browser. No custom sizes can be set in order for this to happen,
3795  * nor scrolling used
3796  */
3797  if ( ! userInputs && ! scrollX && ! scrollY &&
3798  columnCount == _fnVisbleColumns( oSettings ) &&
3799  columnCount == headerCells.length
3800  ) {
3801  for ( i=0 ; i<columnCount ; i++ ) {
3802  columns[i].sWidth = _fnStringToCss( headerCells.eq(i).width() );
3803  }
3804  }
3805  else
3806  {
3807  // Otherwise construct a single row table with the widest node in the
3808  // data, assign any user defined widths, then insert it into the DOM and
3809  // allow the browser to do all the hard work of calculating table widths
3810  var tmpTable = $( table.cloneNode( false ) )
3811  .css( 'visibility', 'hidden' )
3812  .removeAttr( 'id' )
3813  .append( $(oSettings.nTHead).clone( false ) )
3814  .append( $(oSettings.nTFoot).clone( false ) )
3815  .append( $('<tbody><tr/></tbody>') );
3816 
3817  // Remove any assigned widths from the footer (from scrolling)
3818  tmpTable.find('tfoot th, tfoot td').css('width', '');
3819 
3820  var tr = tmpTable.find( 'tbody tr' );
3821 
3822  // Apply custom sizing to the cloned header
3823  headerCells = _fnGetUniqueThs( oSettings, tmpTable.find('thead')[0] );
3824 
3825  for ( i=0 ; i<visibleColumns.length ; i++ ) {
3826  column = columns[ visibleColumns[i] ];
3827 
3828  headerCells[i].style.width = column.sWidthOrig !== null && column.sWidthOrig !== '' ?
3829  _fnStringToCss( column.sWidthOrig ) :
3830  '';
3831  }
3832 
3833  // Find the widest cell for each column and put it into the table
3834  if ( oSettings.aoData.length ) {
3835  for ( i=0 ; i<visibleColumns.length ; i++ ) {
3836  columnIdx = visibleColumns[i];
3837  column = columns[ columnIdx ];
3838 
3839  $( _fnGetWidestNode( oSettings, columnIdx ) )
3840  .clone( false )
3841  .append( column.sContentPadding )
3842  .appendTo( tr );
3843  }
3844  }
3845 
3846  // Table has been built, attach to the document so we can work with it
3847  tmpTable.appendTo( tableContainer );
3848 
3849  // When scrolling (X or Y) we want to set the width of the table as
3850  // appropriate. However, when not scrolling leave the table width as it
3851  // is. This results in slightly different, but I think correct behaviour
3852  if ( scrollX && scrollXInner ) {
3853  tmpTable.width( scrollXInner );
3854  }
3855  else if ( scrollX ) {
3856  tmpTable.css( 'width', 'auto' );
3857 
3858  if ( tmpTable.width() < tableContainer.offsetWidth ) {
3859  tmpTable.width( tableContainer.offsetWidth );
3860  }
3861  }
3862  else if ( scrollY ) {
3863  tmpTable.width( tableContainer.offsetWidth );
3864  }
3865  else if ( tableWidthAttr ) {
3866  tmpTable.width( tableWidthAttr );
3867  }
3868 
3869  // Take into account the y scrollbar
3870  _fnScrollingWidthAdjust( oSettings, tmpTable[0] );
3871 
3872  // Browsers need a bit of a hand when a width is assigned to any columns
3873  // when x-scrolling as they tend to collapse the table to the min-width,
3874  // even if we sent the column widths. So we need to keep track of what
3875  // the table width should be by summing the user given values, and the
3876  // automatic values
3877  if ( scrollX )
3878  {
3879  var total = 0;
3880 
3881  for ( i=0 ; i<visibleColumns.length ; i++ ) {
3882  column = columns[ visibleColumns[i] ];
3883  outerWidth = $(headerCells[i]).outerWidth();
3884 
3885  total += column.sWidthOrig === null ?
3886  outerWidth :
3887  parseInt( column.sWidth, 10 ) + outerWidth - $(headerCells[i]).width();
3888  }
3889 
3890  tmpTable.width( _fnStringToCss( total ) );
3891  table.style.width = _fnStringToCss( total );
3892  }
3893 
3894  // Get the width of each column in the constructed table
3895  for ( i=0 ; i<visibleColumns.length ; i++ ) {
3896  column = columns[ visibleColumns[i] ];
3897  width = $(headerCells[i]).width();
3898 
3899  if ( width ) {
3900  column.sWidth = _fnStringToCss( width );
3901  }
3902  }
3903 
3904  table.style.width = _fnStringToCss( tmpTable.css('width') );
3905 
3906  // Finished with the table - ditch it
3907  tmpTable.remove();
3908  }
3909 
3910  // If there is a width attr, we want to attach an event listener which
3911  // allows the table sizing to automatically adjust when the window is
3912  // resized. Use the width attr rather than CSS, since we can't know if the
3913  // CSS is a relative value or absolute - DOM read is always px.
3914  if ( tableWidthAttr ) {
3915  table.style.width = _fnStringToCss( tableWidthAttr );
3916 
3917  if ( ! oSettings._reszEvt ) {
3918  $(window).bind('resize.DT-'+oSettings.sInstance, _fnThrottle( function () {
3919  _fnAdjustColumnSizing( oSettings );
3920  } ) );
3921 
3922  oSettings._reszEvt = true;
3923  }
3924  }
3925  }
3926 
3927 
3928  function _fnThrottle( fn ) {
3929  var
3930  frequency = 200,
3931  last,
3932  timer;
3933 
3934  return function () {
3935  var
3936  now = +new Date(),
3937  args = arguments;
3938 
3939  if ( last && now < last + frequency ) {
3940  clearTimeout( timer );
3941 
3942  timer = setTimeout( function () {
3943  last = now;
3944  fn();
3945  }, frequency );
3946  }
3947  else {
3948  last = now;
3949  fn();
3950  }
3951  };
3952  }
3953 
3954 
3962  function _fnConvertToWidth ( width, parent )
3963  {
3964  if ( ! width ) {
3965  return 0;
3966  }
3967 
3968  var n = $('<div/>')
3969  .css( 'width', _fnStringToCss( width ) )
3970  .appendTo( parent || document.body );
3971 
3972  var val = n[0].offsetWidth;
3973  n.remove();
3974 
3975  return val;
3976  }
3977 
3978 
3986  function _fnScrollingWidthAdjust ( settings, n )
3987  {
3988  var scroll = settings.oScroll;
3989 
3990  if ( scroll.sX || scroll.sY ) {
3991  // When y-scrolling only, we want to remove the width of the scroll bar
3992  // so the table + scroll bar will fit into the area available, otherwise
3993  // we fix the table at its current size with no adjustment
3994  var correction = ! scroll.sX ? scroll.iBarWidth : 0;
3995  n.style.width = _fnStringToCss( $(n).outerWidth() - correction );
3996  }
3997  }
3998 
3999 
4007  function _fnGetWidestNode( settings, colIdx )
4008  {
4009  var idx = _fnGetMaxLenString( settings, colIdx );
4010  if ( idx < 0 ) {
4011  return null;
4012  }
4013 
4014  var data = settings.aoData[ idx ];
4015  return ! data.nTr ? // Might not have been created when deferred rendering
4016  $('<td/>').html( _fnGetCellData( settings, idx, colIdx, 'display' ) )[0] :
4017  data.anCells[ colIdx ];
4018  }
4019 
4020 
4028  function _fnGetMaxLenString( settings, colIdx )
4029  {
4030  var s, max=-1, maxIdx = -1;
4031 
4032  for ( var i=0, ien=settings.aoData.length ; i<ien ; i++ ) {
4033  s = _fnGetCellData( settings, i, colIdx, 'display' )+'';
4034  s = s.replace( __re_html_remove, '' );
4035 
4036  if ( s.length > max ) {
4037  max = s.length;
4038  maxIdx = i;
4039  }
4040  }
4041 
4042  return maxIdx;
4043  }
4044 
4045 
4052  function _fnStringToCss( s )
4053  {
4054  if ( s === null ) {
4055  return '0px';
4056  }
4057 
4058  if ( typeof s == 'number' ) {
4059  return s < 0 ?
4060  '0px' :
4061  s+'px';
4062  }
4063 
4064  // Check it has a unit character already
4065  return s.match(/\d$/) ?
4066  s+'px' :
4067  s;
4068  }

4099  .appendTo( 'body' );
4100

4102  outer.css( 'overflow', 'scroll' );

4119  function _fnSortFlatten ( settings )
4120  {
4121  var
4122  i, iLen, k, kLen,
4123  aSort = [],
4124  aiOrig = [],
4125  aoColumns = settings.aoColumns,
4126  aDataSort, iCol, sType, srcCol,
4127  fixed = settings.aaSortingFixed,
4128  fixedObj = $.isPlainObject( fixed ),
4129  nestedSort = [],
4130  add = function ( a ) {
4131  if ( a.length && ! $.isArray( a[0] ) ) {
4132  // 1D array
4133  nestedSort.push( a );
4134  }
4135  else {
4136  // 2D array
4137  nestedSort.push.apply( nestedSort, a );
4138  }
4139  };
4140 
4141  // Build the sort array, with pre-fix and post-fix options if they have been
4142  // specified
4143  if ( $.isArray( fixed ) ) {
4144  add( fixed );
4145  }
4146 
4147  if ( fixedObj && fixed.pre ) {
4148  add( fixed.pre );
4149  }
4150 
4151  add( settings.aaSorting );
4152 
4153  if (fixedObj && fixed.post ) {
4154  add( fixed.post );
4155  }
4156 
4157  for ( i=0 ; i<nestedSort.length ; i++ )
4158  {
4159  srcCol = nestedSort[i][0];
4160  aDataSort = aoColumns[ srcCol ].aDataSort;
4161 
4162  for ( k=0, kLen=aDataSort.length ; k<kLen ; k++ )
4163  {
4164  iCol = aDataSort[k];
4165  sType = aoColumns[ iCol ].sType || 'string';
4166 
4167  aSort.push( {
4168  src: srcCol,
4169  col: iCol,
4170  dir: nestedSort[i][1],
4171  index: nestedSort[i][2],
4172  type: sType,
4173  formatter: DataTable.ext.type.order[ sType+"-pre" ]
4174  } );
4175  }
4176  }
4177 
4178  return aSort;
4179  }
4180 
4187  function _fnSort ( oSettings )
4188  {
4189  var
4190  i, ien, iLen, j, jLen, k, kLen,
4191  sDataType, nTh,
4192  aiOrig = [],
4193  oExtSort = DataTable.ext.type.order,
4194  aoData = oSettings.aoData,
4195  aoColumns = oSettings.aoColumns,
4196  aDataSort, data, iCol, sType, oSort,
4197  formatters = 0,
4198  sortCol,
4199  displayMaster = oSettings.aiDisplayMaster,
4200  aSort = _fnSortFlatten( oSettings );
4201 
4202  // Resolve any column types that are unknown due to addition or invalidation
4203  // @todo Can this be moved into a 'data-ready' handler which is called when
4204  // data is going to be used in the table?
4205  _fnColumnTypes( oSettings );
4206 
4207  for ( i=0, ien=aSort.length ; i<ien ; i++ ) {
4208  sortCol = aSort[i];
4209 
4210  // Track if we can use the fast sort algorithm
4211  if ( sortCol.formatter ) {
4212  formatters++;
4213  }
4214 
4215  // Load the data needed for the sort, for each cell
4216  _fnSortData( oSettings, sortCol.col );
4217  }
4218 
4219  /* No sorting required if server-side or no sorting array */
4220  if ( _fnDataSource( oSettings ) != 'ssp' && aSort.length !== 0 )
4221  {
4222  // Create a value - key array of the current row positions such that we can use their
4223  // current position during the sort, if values match, in order to perform stable sorting
4224  for ( i=0, iLen=displayMaster.length ; i<iLen ; i++ ) {
4225  aiOrig[ displayMaster[i] ] = i;
4226  }
4227 
4228  /* Do the sort - here we want multi-column sorting based on a given data source (column)
4229  * and sorting function (from oSort) in a certain direction. It's reasonably complex to
4230  * follow on it's own, but this is what we want (example two column sorting):
4231  * fnLocalSorting = function(a,b){
4232  * var iTest;
4233  * iTest = oSort['string-asc']('data11', 'data12');
4234  * if (iTest !== 0)
4235  * return iTest;
4236  * iTest = oSort['numeric-desc']('data21', 'data22');
4237  * if (iTest !== 0)
4238  * return iTest;
4239  * return oSort['numeric-asc']( aiOrig[a], aiOrig[b] );
4240  * }
4241  * Basically we have a test for each sorting column, if the data in that column is equal,
4242  * test the next column. If all columns match, then we use a numeric sort on the row
4243  * positions in the original data array to provide a stable sort.
4244  *
4245  * Note - I know it seems excessive to have two sorting methods, but the first is around
4246  * 15% faster, so the second is only maintained for backwards compatibility with sorting
4247  * methods which do not have a pre-sort formatting function.
4248  */
4249  if ( formatters === aSort.length ) {
4250  // All sort types have formatting functions
4251  displayMaster.sort( function ( a, b ) {
4252  var
4253  x, y, k, test, sort,
4254  len=aSort.length,
4255  dataA = aoData[a]._aSortData,
4256  dataB = aoData[b]._aSortData;
4257 
4258  for ( k=0 ; k<len ; k++ ) {
4259  sort = aSort[k];
4260 
4261  x = dataA[ sort.col ];
4262  y = dataB[ sort.col ];
4263 
4264  test = x<y ? -1 : x>y ? 1 : 0;
4265  if ( test !== 0 ) {
4266  return sort.dir === 'asc' ? test : -test;
4267  }
4268  }
4269 
4270  x = aiOrig[a];
4271  y = aiOrig[b];
4272  return x<y ? -1 : x>y ? 1 : 0;
4273  } );
4274  }
4275  else {
4276  // Depreciated - remove in 1.11 (providing a plug-in option)
4277  // Not all sort types have formatting methods, so we have to call their sorting
4278  // methods.
4279  displayMaster.sort( function ( a, b ) {
4280  var
4281  x, y, k, l, test, sort, fn,
4282  len=aSort.length,
4283  dataA = aoData[a]._aSortData,
4284  dataB = aoData[b]._aSortData;
4285 
4286  for ( k=0 ; k<len ; k++ ) {
4287  sort = aSort[k];
4288 
4289  x = dataA[ sort.col ];
4290  y = dataB[ sort.col ];
4291 
4292  fn = oExtSort[ sort.type+"-"+sort.dir ] || oExtSort[ "string-"+sort.dir ];
4293  test = fn( x, y );
4294  if ( test !== 0 ) {
4295  return test;
4296  }
4297  }
4298 
4299  x = aiOrig[a];
4300  y = aiOrig[b];
4301  return x<y ? -1 : x>y ? 1 : 0;
4302  } );
4303  }
4304  }
4305 
4306  /* Tell the draw function that we have sorted the data */
4307  oSettings.bSorted = true;
4308  }

4317  var oAria = settings.oLanguage.oAria;
4318 
4319  // ARIA attributes - need to loop all columns, to update all (removing old
4320  // attributes as needed)
4321  for ( var i=0, iLen=columns.length ; i<iLen ; i++ )
4322  {
4323  var col = columns[i];

4325  var sTitle = col.sTitle.replace( /<.*?>/g, "" );

4339  oAria.sSortAscending :
4340  oAria.sSortDescending

4362  function _fnSortListener ( settings, colIdx, append, callback )
4363  {
4364  var col = settings.aoColumns[ colIdx ];
4365  var sorting = settings.aaSorting;
4366  var asSorting = col.asSorting;
4367  var nextSortIdx;
4368  var next = function ( a ) {
4369  var idx = a._idx;
4370  if ( idx === undefined ) {
4371  idx = $.inArray( a[1], asSorting );
4372  }
4373 
4374  return idx+1 >= asSorting.length ? 0 : idx+1;
4375  };
4376 
4377  // If appending the sort then we are multi-column sorting
4378  if ( append && settings.oFeatures.bSortMulti ) {
4379  // Are we already doing some kind of sort on this column?
4380  var sortIdx = $.inArray( colIdx, _pluck(sorting, '0') );
4381 
4382  if ( sortIdx !== -1 ) {
4383  // Yes, modify the sort
4384  nextSortIdx = next( sorting[sortIdx] );
4385 
4386  sorting[sortIdx][1] = asSorting[ nextSortIdx ];
4387  sorting[sortIdx]._idx = nextSortIdx;
4388  }
4389  else {
4390  // No sort on this column yet
4391  sorting.push( [ colIdx, asSorting[0], 0 ] );
4392  sorting[sorting.length-1]._idx = 0;
4393  }
4394  }
4395  else if ( sorting.length && sorting[0][0] == colIdx ) {
4396  // Single column - already sorting on this column, modify the sort
4397  nextSortIdx = next( sorting[0] );
4398 
4399  sorting.length = 1;
4400  sorting[0][1] = asSorting[ nextSortIdx ];
4401  sorting[0]._idx = nextSortIdx;
4402  }
4403  else {
4404  // Single column - sort only on this column
4405  sorting.length = 0;
4406  sorting.push( [ colIdx, asSorting[0] ] );
4407  sorting[0]._idx = 0;
4408  }
4409 
4410  // Run the sort by calling a full redraw
4411  _fnReDraw( settings );
4412 
4413  // callback used for async user interaction
4414  if ( typeof callback == 'function' ) {
4415  callback( settings );
4416  }
4417  }
